title: Problem syncing Energy Web Chain - "Unable to init the peer manager" error
body:
**OS**: Ubuntu 18.04.4
**Nethermind client**: 1.8-41
**Chain**: Energy Web Chain (PoA network - very similar to Volta)

**Problem**: I've successfully synced the Volta testnet but when I add a config and chainspec for Energy Web Chain (the mainnet to the Volta testnet), it throws an error on startup and fails to find peers. Both networks use AuRa Proof-of-Authority spec and I've edited the config file to use the correct GenesisHash and PivotHash.

**Chainspec**: https://github.com/energywebfoundation/ewf-chainspec/blob/master/EnergyWebChain.json

**energyweb.cfg**:
```
{
  "Init": {      
    "WebSocketsEnabled": false,
    "StoreReceipts" : true,
    "IsMining": false,
    "ChainSpecPath": "chainspec/energyweb.json",
    "GenesisHash": "0x0b6d3e680af2fc525392c720666cce58e3d8e6fe75ba4b48cb36bcc69039229b",
    "BaseDbPath": "nethermind_db/energyweb",
    "LogFileName": "energyweb.logs.txt"
  },
  "Network": {
    "DiscoveryPort": 30303,
    "P2PPort": 30303
  },
  "JsonRpc": {
    "Enabled": false,
    "Host": "127.0.0.1",
    "Port": 8545    
  },
  "Db": {
    "WriteBufferSize": 16000000,
    "WriteBufferNumber": 4,
    "BlockCacheSize": 128000000,
    "CacheIndexAndFilterBlocks": true,
    "BlockInfosDbCacheIndexAndFilterBlocks": false
  },
  "Sync": {
    "FastSync": true,
    "PivotNumber" : 4000000,
    "PivotHash" : "0x4be7f727e22b9482b0fe36714cb3bad5688a6bce41e2e93478a90f7d403eb7b4",
    "PivotTotalDifficulty" : "1361129467683753853853498430000000000000000000",
    "FastBlocks" : true,
    "UseGethLimitsInFastBlocks" : false,
    "FastSyncCatchUpHeightDelta": 10000000000
  },
  "EthStats": {
    "Enabled": false,
    "Server": "ws://localhost:3000/api",
    "Name": "Nethermind Energy Web",
    "Secret": "secret",
    "Contact": "hello@nethermind.io"
  },
  "Metrics": {
    "NodeName": "Energy_Web",
    "Enabled": false,
    "PushGatewayUrl": "http://localhost:9091/metrics",
    "IntervalSeconds": 5
  }
}
```

**Errors from line 8 onward**:

```
2020-05-27 15:56:01.7826|INFO|1|Grafana / Prometheus metrics are disabled in configuration 
2020-05-27 15:56:02.2883|INFO|1|Using http://ipv4.icanhazip.com to get external ip 
2020-05-27 15:56:03.5485|INFO|1|Block tree initialized, last processed is 0 (0x0b6d3e...39229b), best queued is 0, best known is 0, lowest inserted header , body  
2020-05-27 15:56:03.8337|INFO|1|No block tree levels to review for fixes. All fine. 
2020-05-27 15:56:03.8580|WARN|1|Using the local IP override: NetworkConfig.LocalIp = 10.0.2.15 
2020-05-27 15:56:03.8580|WARN|1|Using the external IP override: NetworkConfig.ExternalIp = 24.9.202.110 
2020-05-27 15:56:04.0563|INFO|6|Loaded 0 static nodes from file: /home/ad/nethermind/Data/static-nodes.json 
2020-05-27 15:56:04.2161|ERROR|5|Unable to init the peer manager. System.FormatException: An invalid IP address was specified.
 ---> System.Net.Sockets.SocketException (22): Invalid argument
   --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
   at System.Net.IPAddressParser.Parse(ReadOnlySpan`1 ipSpan, Boolean tryParse)
   at System.Net.IPAddress.Parse(String ipString)
   at Nethermind.Stats.Model.Node.SetIPEndPoint(String host, Int32 port)
   at Nethermind.Network.PeerLoader.LoadConfigPeers(List`1 peers, IEnumerable`1 networkNodes, Action`1 nodeUpdate)
   at Nethermind.Network.PeerLoader.LoadConfigPeers(List`1 peers, String enodesString, Action`1 nodeUpdate)
   at Nethermind.Network.PeerLoader.LoadPeers(IEnumerable`1 staticNodes)
   at Nethermind.Network.PeerManager.LoadPersistedPeers()
   at Nethermind.Network.PeerManager.Init()
   at Nethermind.Runner.Ethereum.Steps.InitializeNetwork.InitPeer()
2020-05-27 15:56:04.5133|INFO|1|ReceiptsDb migration disabled. Finding logs when multiple blocks receipts need to be scanned might be slow. 
2020-05-27 15:56:04.5665|INFO|1|
======================== Nethermind initialization completed ========================
Version      : 1.8.41-0-8452b7da9-20200527/X64-Linux 5.3.0-28-generic/Core3.1.3
This node    : enode://63e87cab4871b767b26a24a139da80adbc7fc3535a581435cccfb0fa46b2602b6de34da708fb6ef413e4d336b4beb2c123509475fe945446169840e2eedc9d01@24.9.202.110:30303
Node address : 0x6b3681a2b2ae5c3c6d8d0a93a579dadddf5de803 (do not use as an account)
Mem est tx   :     78MB
Mem est trie :    240MB
Mem est peers:     50MB
Mem est netty:     33MB
Mem est DB   :    487MB
Mem est      :    888MB
Genesis hash : 0x0b6d3e680af2fc525392c720666cce58e3d8e6fe75ba4b48cb36bcc69039229b
External IP  : 
Ethereum     : 
Discovery    : 
DB location  : nethermind_db/energyweb
Chainspec    : chainspec/energyweb.json
Chain ID     : 246
Chain head   : 0 (0x0b6d3e...39229b)
===================================================================================== 
2020-05-27 15:56:04.5720|INFO|1|Json RPC is disabled 
2020-05-27 15:56:04.8546|INFO|6|Waiting for peers... 1s 
2020-05-27 15:56:04.8571|INFO|6|Sync peers - Initialized: 0 | All: 0 | Max: 50 
2020-05-27 15:56:05.8576|INFO|21|Waiting for peers... 2s
```

@LukaszRozmej would you check if the host names (not IP addresses) are allowed for bootnodes in chainspec.
This should be easy to fix since we already support it in other places.
Then would you be able to check quickly if you can sync this (and Volta).

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/498913/83079173-27f0d800-a073-11ea-98cd-d9295f844ace.png)

@WendellCathcart we will check that and will get back to you - this seems to be an issue with the bootnodes being required to be speced with IP addresses
we will aim at fixing it soon
Great, thanks. I'll test replacing the bootnode URLs with IP addresses

If the pivot is not right for your chain it will not sync:
    "PivotNumber" : 4000000,
    "PivotHash" : "0x4be7f727e22b9482b0fe36714cb3bad5688a6bce41e2e93478a90f7d403eb7b4",
    "PivotTotalDifficulty" : "1361129467683753853853498430000000000000000000",
Is it a pivot from Volta? You can remove these three lines or update to some recent block on your chain

I updated the config file to use the hash and difficulty for block 4,000,000 for Energy Web Chain so that should be alright unless I did it wrong :) http://explorer.energyweb.org/blocks/4000000/transactions

We will merge this tomorrow: Support DNS names in chainspec #1972
We have added pivot config for block 5900000.

It has to be total difficulty
Awesome, thanks for your quick help with this!!
testing sync on our machines now

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/498913/83137238-bb142700-a0e0-11ea-890f-4d772bd917c8.png)
try with FastSync false maybe?
@WendellCathcart I will try to fully sync entire chain in archive mode and will let you know if all was good

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/498913/83146248-ed785100-a0ed-11ea-994b-d387b849ec98.png)
just running full archive on it in the background on my machine - looks good so far and I believe that the later blocks are more empty

@tkstanczak thanks again for all of your help with this!
One small thing I noticed and one question:
First - I started syncing EWC with the latest release and it looks like energyweb.cfg specifies "energyWeb.json" as the chainspec which doesn't match what's in the chainspec folder ("energyweb.json"). Easy fix but wanted to flag that.

Also, I'm having mixed experience finding peers with both the volta and energyweb chains. For instance during the EWC sync it had 1 peer for about 10 minutes but now it's been "Waiting for peers..." + "Could not communicate with any nodes" for quite a while.

Did you encounter this and is there anything you'd recommend trying?

Yes, we have seen it with EWC when syncing from dynamic IPs and we were not sure what was going on. I think it was mainly in the fast sync as the archive synced nodes re running very well.

The node that I started 4 days ago has been running all the time since then and has 28 peers now:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/498913/83454174-b5f20780-a453-11ea-8764-96a84331f1b6.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/498913/83454312-e20d8880-a453-11ea-84fc-07575d02720e.png)

Are you running on a dynamic IP or behind a NAT?
Are you fully synced? maybe you can share the logs?
I think that the state sync with Parity nodes is a bit unstable - we have seen it also on POA Core sync. After it sync it is fine but the state sync drops peers often.
I will run energy web fast sync on the lastest version on a vm to try

I have justlaunched it from scratch and connected to our metrics on Grafana so will be able to verify how the sync progresses:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/498913/83456391-8f35d000-a457-11ea-94a8-ae3bb27d446e.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/498913/83457219-1c2d5900-a459-11ea-9f6e-f5d9c5e32f33.png)
so far very stable 15 peers but I want to see what happens when it switches to state sync (after bodies nd receipts are downloaded)

Ah, thanks for the insight. I am behind a dynamic IP but syncing worked pretty consistently just last week with the same connection, so I'm not sure how to explain it. Here are the logs.

[energyweb.logs.txt](https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/files/4713715/energyweb.logs.txt)

So I was able to sync today in under an hour on my local laptop and similarly on a VM.
I will review the logs tomorrow.
@WendellCathcart one important thing to add - the chain is very light so if we replace the config properly we can probably run the node with less than 500MB RAM
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/498913/83463673-a4662b00-a466-11ea-8107-3fcc8af80230.png)

Hmm, I also got the EWC node to fully sync, but haven't had success syncing Volta. I set the Volta node on a DigitalOcean instance (static IP), used the latest release, and it still has trouble finding peers. I even tried disabling Fast Sync. Did you have trouble syncing Volta?

So I tried running my local node with some old peer db. I've got:

You can try with those nodes either putting enodes to static enodes file or just dropping attached
[peers.zip](https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/files/4726647/peers.zip)

Trying from fresh DB I managed to connect to 4 peers almost instantaneously

@WendellCathcart  - the chainspec file was not updated after the latest Ethereum hard forks
also the Parity chainspec for the latest hard fork is not compatible with Nethermind (latest hard fork was the first one where we had to updated chainspec before Parity as ready and I do not think they cared about being compatible with us).

I have updated it on the master branch, I have also updated pivot.
Now we are syncing volta just fine.
